document.title: Health Education Content Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

F90D3E80DFE30131918268A86D17958E.description: Encourage others to promote a healthy environment.

F90CFBF0DFE30131918168A86D17958E.description: Support others in making positive health choices.

F90CB6C0DFE30131918068A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F90C71E0DFE30131917F68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate ways to reduce, reuse, and recycle at home, at school, and in the community.

F90C2A10DFE30131917E68A86D17958E.description: Evaluate ways to prevent the transmission of communicable diseases.

F90BDCE0DFE30131917D68A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F90B9430DFE30131917C68A86D17958E.description: Set a short-term goal for positive health practices.

F90B3E40DFE30131917B68A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F90AE8E0DFE30131917A68A86D17958E.description: Use a decision-making process to reduce the risk of communicable disease or illness.

F90A8FF0DFE30131917968A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F90A3EF0DFE30131917868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate refusal skills to avoid the spread of disease.

F909FE90DFE30131917768A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F909C030DFE30131917668A86D17958E.description: Describe how to access help when feeling threatened.

F9098000DFE30131917568A86D17958E.description: Recognize individuals who can assist with health-related issues and potentially life-threatening health conditions (e.g., asthma episodes or seizures).

F9093D70DFE30131917468A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F908FB40DFE30131917368A86D17958E.description: Identify how culture, family, friends, and media influence positive health practices.

F908B090DFE30131917268A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9085E30DFE30131917168A86D17958E.description: Discuss how reducing, recycling, and reusing products make for a healthier environment.

F9081E10DFE30131917068A86D17958E.description: Describe how a healthy environment is essential to personal and community health.

F907DDE0DFE30131916F68A86D17958E.description: Identify life-threatening conditions (e.g., heart attacks, asthma attacks, poisoning).

F9079C40DFE30131916E68A86D17958E.description: Identify positive health practices that reduce illness and disease.

F9075AD0DFE30131916D68A86D17958E.description: Describe how bacteria and viruses affect the body.

F90716B0DFE30131916C68A86D17958E.description: Examine the difference between communicable and noncommunicable diseases.

F906C900DFE30131916B68A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

F9061FB0DFE30131916968A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to support and respect people with differences.

F905CF10DFE30131916868A86D17958E.description: Object appropriately to teasing of peers and family members that is based on personal characteristics.

F9058550DFE30131916768A86D17958E.description: Promote a positive and respectful school environment.

F9051EC0DFE30131916668A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F904CBF0DFE30131916568A86D17958E.description: Evaluate effective strategies to cope with fear, stress, anger, loss, and grief in oneself and others.

F90485B0DFE30131916468A86D17958E.description: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F9044130DFE30131916368A86D17958E.description: Make a plan to help at home and show responsibility as a family member.

F903F980DFE30131916268A86D17958E.description: Goal Setting - All students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting skills to enhance health.
comments: The desire to pursue health is an essential component of building healthy habits. The ability to use goal-setting skills enables students to translate health knowledge into personally meaningful health behaviors.

F903B170DFE30131916168A86D17958E.description: Evaluate situations in which a trusted adult should be asked for help.

F9034580DFE30131916068A86D17958E.description: Describe effective strategies to cope with changes within the family.

F902F880DFE30131915F68A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F902B480DFE30131915E68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate how to communicate directly, respectfully, and assertively regarding personal boundaries.

F9026DE0DFE30131915D68A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F9022530DFE30131915C68A86D17958E.description: Access trusted adults at home, at school, and in the community who can help with mental, emotional, and social health concerns.

F901DCD0DFE30131915B68A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F9018760DFE30131915A68A86D17958E.description: Describe internal and external factors that affect friendships and family relationships.

F9011150DFE30131915968A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F900C0F0DFE30131915868A86D17958E.description: Discuss the importance of setting (and ways to set) personal boundaries for privacy, safety, and expression of emotions.

F9007FD0DFE30131915768A86D17958E.description: Explain the benefits of having positive relationships with family and friends.

F9003BE0DFE30131915668A86D17958E.description: Describe the importance of assuming responsibility within the family and community.

F8FFF3A0DFE30131915568A86D17958E.description: Describe examples of healthy social behaviors (e.g., helping others, being respectful of others, cooperation, consideration).

F8FFA120DFE30131915468A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.

F8FEFF60DFE30131915268A86D17958E.description: Encourage peers to show respect for others regardless of differences in growth and development.

F8FEBE90DFE30131915168A86D17958E.description: Health Promotion - All students will demonstrate the ability to promote and support personal, family, and community health.
comments: Personal, family, and community health are interdependent and mutually supporting. The ability to promote the health of oneself and others reflects a well-rounded development and expression of health.

F8FE7CE0DFE30131915068A86D17958E.description: Determine behaviors that promote healthy growth and development.

F8FE3800DFE30131914F68A86D17958E.description: Standard 7: Practicing Health-Enhancing Behaviors - All students will demonstrate the ability to practice behaviors that reduce risk and promote health.
comments: Practicing healthy behaviors builds competence and confidence to use learned skills in real-life situations. The ability to adopt health-enhancing behaviors demonstrates students' ability to use knowledge and skills to manage health and reduce risk-taking behaviors.

F8FDF300DFE30131914E68A86D17958E.description: Examine why a variety of behaviors promote healthy growth and development.

F8FDA220DFE30131914D68A86D17958E.description: Decision Making - All students will demonstrate the ability to use decision-making skills to enhance health.
comments: Managing health behaviors requires critical thinking and problem solving. The ability to use decision-making skills to guide health behaviors fosters a sense of control and promotes the acceptance of personal responsibility.

F8FD5850DFE30131914C68A86D17958E.description: Identify how to show respect for individual differences.

F8FD1820DFE30131914B68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate how to communicate with parents, guardians, and trusted adults about growth and development.

F8FCD4E0DFE30131914A68A86D17958E.description: Interpersonal Communication - All students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health.
comments: Positive relationships support the development of healthy attitudes and behaviors. The ability to appropriately convey and receive information, beliefs, and emotions is a skill that enables students to manage risk, conflict, and differences and to promote health.

F8FC8F10DFE30131914968A86D17958E.description: Identify parents, guardians, and trusted adults with whom one can discuss the cycle of birth, growth, aging, and death in living things.

F8FC4500DFE30131914868A86D17958E.description: Accessing Valid Information - All students will demonstrate the ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services.
comments: Students are exposed to numerous sources of information, products, and services. The ability to access and analyze health information, products, and services provides a foundation for practicing health-enhancing behaviors. Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F8FBF150DFE30131914768A86D17958E.description: Explain how individual behaviors and one's family and school influence growth and development.

F8FBA2A0DFE30131914668A86D17958E.description: Analyzing Influences - All students will demonstrate the ability to analyze internal and external influences that affect health.
comments: Health choices are affected by a variety of influences. The ability to recognize, analyze, and evaluate internal and external influences is essential to protecting and enhancing health.

F8FB6270DFE30131914568A86D17958E.description: Identify major internal and external body parts and their functions.

F8FB21E0DFE30131914468A86D17958E.description: Recognize that there are individual differences in growth and development.

F8FAE080DFE30131914368A86D17958E.description: Describe the cycle of birth, growth, aging, and death in living things.

F8FA9B80DFE30131914268A86D17958E.description: Essential Concepts - All students will comprehend essential concepts related to enhancing health.
comments: Understanding essential concepts about the relationships between behavior and health provides the foundation for making informed decisions about health-related behaviors and for selecting appropriate health products and services.
